p: Likewise, the respondents were screened to procure knowledge of malaria via the common symptoms they experienced ( Figure 3) Fever, body pain, fatigue, and headache are the common symptoms in the study area and are related to temperature balance of the body system. The local people believed that it could be caused by excessive heat and long-time exposure to cold environment which forces the body to produce excessive heat. Moreover, they explained that fever could lead to other symptoms such as headache, fatigue, body pain, and sweating. According to the respondents, probable ways of preventing malaria include reduction in exposure to rain (cold areas) or sun (hot areas), avoidance of mosquito bites, reduction in workload (stress), constant use of antimalarial herbal drugs, and burning of aromatic antimalarial plants which could pose threats to mosquitoes.
